title: Girl, 16, lost fingernails in nightclub attack by ‘jealous’ woman
text:
Jacee was at the bar of Passion nightclub in Sunderland when she became involved in a melee

A mother has said her daughter ended up in hospital after going to a nightclub in an attack that was fuelled by jealousy.

Jacee Pink, 16, who wants to be a singer and a model, told her mum that she was going out for dinner with friends on Saturday night.

In fact, she was secretly plotting to go to Passion Nightclub in Sunderland, despite being underage.

While at the bar she became involved in a scuffle and ended up in an attack that saw her lose her fingernails and require scans for concussion after being kicked and dragged around.

Her mother Amy Pink said: ‘Jacee was at the bar, then all of a sudden the woman was pushing, grabbing and then kicking her while she was on the floor.

Jacee Pink was out with friends at Passion Nightclub in Sunderland (Picture: NCJM)

‘She’s been kicked in the head a few times and has been very dizzy. She’s frightened and she is only still a child.

‘She was crying afterwards and asked “why have I been targeted?”. She is a pretty girl and feels targeted because of that.

‘Nobody knows what has happened but I think it is has been instigated through jealousy, it is completely unprovoked and it has to all be down to jealousy.’

Amy said a video of her daughter modelling for Breast Cancer UK has had nearly 20,000 views on YoutTube.

Speaking about her daughter sneaking to a club instead of going out for food, Amy said: ‘I’d done it myself when I was her age, I’d tell my dad I was going to Pizza Hut then I’d be in the pubs and clubs.

Jacee’s mum believes the attack was fuelled by jealousy because her daughter is an aspiring singer and model (Picture: NCJM)

Jacee had told her mother she was going for dinner with friends (Picture: NCJM)

‘But normally she is good and responsible and I had no issue with what she’s done, just what happened to her.

‘She doesn’t deserve this and I hope the police charge someone for what has happened.’

Since the attack, Amy says Jacee has been trolled online. She said: ‘There’s been horrible Facebook messages sent to us and I’ve had men calling up threatening us.

‘They were asking “where do you f**king live” – but I just thought these people must be idiots.’

A spokesperson for Northumbria Police said: ‘Shortly after 4pm on Sunday, police received a report of an assault near Passion nightclub in Sunderland.

Jacee lost some fingernails in the assault that police are investigating (Picture: NCJM)

‘The assault is believed to have happened around midnight on Saturday and reported to police the following day.

‘It was reported that a woman assaulted a 16-year-old teenager who was then taken to hospital with a suspected concussion.’

The club said it is carrying out its own investigations.
